WRITING.TEXT: Furthermore, in the final scene, Luke was in near tears when he was looking at her. I don't think he was crying over the sight of his lightsaber... Fuck that scene was awesome
This guy fucks
Double tap to wake + swipe nav bar to sleep (Cataclysm ROM), so awesome!
Sounds like total Mayhem
Came here for pink Floyd drama. 100% agree with your comment. Total 1980s prick but so talented. The recent Wall concert he did was stellar though.

Graphite, looks nice but scratches easy. Put a white carbon dbrand skin on it with a coloured X, then slapped a Orzly clear case on it with the dbrand skin. Not sure I like it like this, but I'll keep using it for now. The power and volume buttons are stiff with the case and it's probably because of the added thickness of the skin.
I want to try a spigen case with a dbrand skin on it as was posted by another user a couple weeks ago.
It may take some time, but things usually end up getting to where their supposed to. Odds are those customers will get two shipments and their credit now.
This question needs an answer. I waited months for Priv, saw the price, bought a Nexus 6P.
Tempered glass.

Honestly, use a protector with the front camera protected. Shit likes to build up around the cutouts and it'll probably dirty the camera. If it's covered you just give it a quick wipe to clean it off. The protectors don't really interfere with image quality.

WRITING.TITLE: Any updates on progress?
WRITING.TEXT:
So after the overwhelming support from the r/Android thread from a few weeks, has their been any more thoughts about bringing Fusion back? Is it actually underway?
I'd love nothing more than a better improved version of hangouts and your suggestions ticked all the right boxes for what I would want in an IM.
Thanks!
Is there some sort of visual optimization when running at 493? I'm at 480, does it affect it much?
480 here as well.
Would having the screen off access enable add any significant battery drain?

Count me in for Bluetooth and car audio issues. 2013 Ford C-max, frequently the phone forgets being paired with my vehicle and I have to go through it again. Other times I can't keep the phone in my pocket or the audio clips in and out. I've experience the same issue with a call only once though. I'm fairly sure it's software related.

Wait I'm confused. What price adjustment did they give you?
I ordered the MBKHD 3 pack ($22.95) a month ago in US currency and it came out to $31 CAD.
Noticed some warmth. Feels normal. It honestly runs cooler than my nexus 5 under the same usage.

I received my two protectors two days ago. I didn't like the way the bottom speaker was cut out. I contacted IntelliArmor and they were quick to ship me out two new protector one case friendly and one edge to edge with the revised speaker cut out.
I only received shipping confirmation for the case friendly version. Edge to edge must not be ready yet.
Their customer support is really top notch.
I wish I knew what was causing. It's only happening in my vehicle. My wife's Nexus 5 stays connected fine.
Screen facing leg. Testicles radiated.

WRITING.TITLE: Bluetooth not sync'ing again?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'll start off by saying that I absolutely love my Nexus 6P. It was a great upgrade from my Nexus 5 which was a solid phone. My only issue with my 6P is Bluetooth and I'm not sure if it's common or not. I have a UE Mini Boom speaker in my kitchen which I use on a daily basis and it works great, there's never and connection issues or stream interruptions. The problem I'm having is in my vehicle. I have 2013 Ford C-Max, the phone pairs fine and will work for maybe a day. Music streaming is odd a times where I can't leave the phone in my pocket or it'll cut in and out. The biggest problem is after maybe a day or so, the phone forgets to pair with my car again and I have to go through the process again. The phone is still registered by my car but when I try to connect, my phone doesn't do anything and I have to go through the entire pairing process again.
Is anyone else experience similar Bluetooth issues with any other vehicles or accessories? My Nexus 5 never gave me any problems with Bluetooth in my car.
Better safe than sorry?
Hahaha I had to listen to that too many times while applying the skin on mine.
Ordered mine Oct 30th, still nothing :(

No this actually helped a lot thanks. I prefer having the back visor partially covered for added protection so that's a plus for the one I'm getting. I may like that TPU/Plastic combo better though, I'll have to see!
Many of us are using are phones case-less. It's been said that some of the bulky cases are also responsible for phones bending. What did you do to cause the bend?
My Intelli protectors should be arriving soon I hope. I ordered on Oct 30. I'll definitely be trying this method. Thanks for the tip!
OP failed to deliver the expected.
I have an Orzly clear case coming in the mail. Do you know if it's close to or on par with the Spigen one you have?

Here's my take on it, and it may resolve many of your gripes. I don't buy Nexus phones, nor would I recommend them to anyone, in order to just run the phone stock. It's missing a bunch of features and UI improvements that Google is reluctant to add in. I buy Nexus phones because they're so easy to modify. The same day I bought my Nexus 6P, I unlocked the bootloader and installed a custom ROM.
When friends ask me what phone they should buy, I always tell them to get something other than a Nexus if they don't want to spend time modifying the phone to their liking. I'll typically steer them towards an LG/Moto/Sony phone.
You're right, i just checked Amplify on the play store and it's in the description. I may have to reinstall xposed and give it a try.
Don't burn your phone with a lighter?
Can't you get these without Xposed? Does it provide additional functionality or something?

My retired Nexus 5, thought about selling it, but I just can't let go. Relegated to backup in the event my 6P fails.
It's also fun to pick up every now and then after using my 6P. It feels like a little plastic toy.
I've got my tickets for the 17th, don't let the hype die!
I'll say it again, thanks a lot for putting in this much effort.

Haha yup, my wife asked me to adjust something on her N5, I picked it up and it felt like a little toy. Light, plastic and small. It's funny because that's how I felt about my iPhone 5 after switching to the N5.
My only no was the size, but I'm getting used to it. EVERYTHING ELSE, FUCK YES!
I got the same thing. People have no clue what a Nexus is and are surprised Google is involved in making the phones. Too many Apple and Samsung drones in my office.

In an effort to actually help you, I suggest you contact Google directly. From what I've read, they've been very helpful and quick to replace phones with issues. You may just want to leave out the part that you dropped it and claim that it just doesn't work right.

I lost my God given right to a carrier store employee! It was the first one to arrive in my region and she was going on about how she couldn't wait to see what it looks like....she opened it, in front of me. I almost cried. In reality though, they open all the boxes to set up the SIM and stuff for customers.

MKBHD is always very tough on battery life. He usually runs at 100% brightness with all toggles on. He states so himself in other videos, he always pushes the phone hard. You're only way to compare is to watch his other reviews for battery life. For example, he said the same of the Nexus 6P yet I'm doubling his SOT.

Xposed allows for additional system based tweaks. Gravity Box is a module of Xposed which basically allows for lots of UI and system tweaks. It's full of features, too many to list out. For people who love modifying their phones and tweaking them this is the way to go.
Can confirm all of the above. Love my 6P. Such a huge boost in battery life vs my Nexus 5. Now that Xposed and Gravity Box (MM) are available, there's no looking back.
This is worthy of r/unexpected
Fuck good call. Too late to go back though, I already bent it, ran it over with my car, pierced the battery with a drill and melted in a large vat of acid.
This is why I ordered two from Intelli but they're still not here. The paranoia is real!
The unknowns are rage inducing! I must bend my phone now.

I don't have those problems.
The only issue I'm having is with Bluetooth and my car. I have a 2013 Ford C-Max and it's hit or miss if the phone connects to the car. It seems like every time I turn Bluetooth on and off it forgets to pair with my car. It doesn't forget about my bluetooth speaker or my Mi Band. My Nexus 5 never gave me any issues. Furthermore, when my 6P is connected, I can't keep it in my pocket. I have to place it in the cup holder otherwise the music keeps cutting in and out.
I have a UE mini boom in my kitchen and it never has trouble syncing or playing music with that. So I'm not sure what's going on. I don't think I can fully blame the phone, but again, my Nexus 5 never gave me any problems. That phone was champ.

You definitely have shitty luck. My 32gb graphite does not have this issue. In fact I haven't encountered any of the issues everyone else seems to be complaining about.

This is why I stopped using eBay. I much meeting in person in a public place to conduct these transactions now. But that inevitably leads to dickheads not showing up and wasting my time. It's still a better alternative to eBay.

I felt the same about my N5. But after using my 6P for a couple weeks I don't really miss it. Just the battery life alone on my 6P is enough to make me forget about my N5.
I convinced my wife to ditch her iPhone 5 for my N5.
Would push setting ever be advised? I have my Hotmail set to push instead of a regular frequency.

496 #1 carbon adopted #2 OEAGO white
Thanks OP!

I've had to do this in my Ford. Music kept clipping out every few seconds, took it out of my pocket and it worked. At home in the kitchen, it'll be in my pocket the whole time and there's no issues playing to my Bluetooth speaker. Much weird.

It sucks, but I'm trying to hold out for wider C to C availability. I'm not going to invest in a bunch of A to C cables just so I can use my old chargers. I'd rather get newer USB C chargers and just replace everything. But availability other than expensive Google sucks.

I don't know what other people do, but I'm swapping custom ROMs, all I do is offload my pictures. Everything else is in the clouds or early recoverable. During initial setup, Google can restore from a backup which basically redownloads all your apps and restores WiFi passwords

Oh then that's a different issue. What prompts the reboot? Does it force close the app and then reboot itself? Does the phone freeze up?
Odds are you need to do what u/malcalypsetheyounger suggested below. If it persists then contact Google.

Your inbox probably exploded, but yes, for everyone's sanity, please bring Fusion back!!!
I think we can all agree the hangouts app is fucking shit. I would gladly donate to your cause!

Title was a bit misleading, I thought your phone was fucked up or something. Apps crashing on a phone is nothing to be worried about. Unless your phone app is crashing every time you open it, just carry on. Chrome is chrome, you'll see it crash at random intervals. These are just software issues, updates or re-installs will fix them if they get progressively worse.
A+ for this guy's efforts
Not for a Nexus device

Can confirm, ass saved the first night I got my 6P. I made a mistake and screwed up something while trying to install a custom ROM. My only option was fastboot commands to restore the phone.
Multirom on my N5 had made the process so trivial, I had forgotten some additional steps when replacing the internal OS :)
Unlocking your bootloader is required, that will format your data partition.

I fully intend to as well. But I'm waiting for a bit more development. Also hoping Multirom makes its way over soon. I'm not a fan of replacing my stock ROM, I like leaving it there in case I fuck something up.
You should make post on LifeProTips

I've been checking this spreadsheet every day waiting for a charger that's not the expensive Google ones. They're even more pricey in Canada! If I'm investing in this new standard I'm going full USB-C cables and charges. Fuck A to C cables
Oh my... I'm going to test this tomorrow at work!

WRITING.TITLE: Elevators should have an undo button

WRITING.TEXT: I have no choice since my Mi Band doesn't want to work with smart unlock on 6.0
If you're looking for major OEM release. I think it'll go HTC, Samsung, LG in late Q1 early Q2.
Nexus 4, 5, 6, 7, 9... then they shat the bed with 5X and 6P.
Can confirm. Battery is amazing. Just last night with doze I lost 0%. I used to carry cable with me for my N5. I have no problem leaving home for the day and worrying about charging now.
Fuck imperial
Depends where you are. I got one off Canada amazon for $11. Took about two weeks to arrive. Seemed to work just fine.
Does using a darker ui really provide significant battery savings? My 6P is my first amoled screen
And the awful restrictions. I grew tired of the cat and mouse game between apple and the jailbreak community. Android opened my eyes. I can't wait for multirom to make its way to the nexus 6P.

Ok so ignoring the pre-touch screen blasphemy... your selection in phones is uncanny.
Random question for my new BFF. After using your N5 for so long, would you ever consider going back to an iPhone?

Had mine for a few days. Totally fine. My phone skins, case and glass protectors are taking their sweet time to arrive so I'm paranoid as hell. My 4yr old knocked it off the night stand yesterday morning, it took a little thump on the wooden bed frame then fell on the carpet. No damage at all. My heart skipped a beat while I was reaching to pick it up.
I've had a number of phones over the years and I've never shattered a screen, dunno why I'm so paranoid. It's all these damn posts about how fragile the 6P is being made out to be.
I went from a N5 to this. The size is taking some adjustment and frankly I miss the matte plastic feel of the N5. The 6P is super slick, but the construction is much more solid than the N5.

This is indeed bizzaro world.
Some shitty nokia phone Blackberry Pearl iPhone 3GS iPhone 4 iPhone 5 Nexus 5 Nexus 6P

I felt the same after trying it in store. After two+ years of swipe typing it felt unnatural to be using a physical keyboard. I think it's only going to appeal to people who absolutely hate onscreen keyboards. Some good notes about the lag and crashing between the verge and MS reviews.

Thanks for the tip, but I never overnight charge my phone. I have access to charging at work all day so even if I'm at 30% going to sleep I won't charge it. Bonus, with the 6P I've been losing at most 2% overnight so it's really not an issue :)
My only regret is the bigger size, but I'm getting used it. I had to make the same adjustment two years ago going from iPhone 5 to Nexus 5.

much MUCH better. I can't emphasize this more. My N5 was struggling after 2 years. I swapped the battery in September and it was noticeably better. Now on my 6P it's a big difference. I don't run much in the background and I have my doze modified to be more aggressive. I can't give you an accurate SOT but my real world use it's significantly better. I used to Reddit on my N5 and watch the % tick down every couple of minutes. I can get through a few threads on my 6P and not lose 1%. Custom ROMs will improve this further, development is well underway.

I got my graphite via my carrier and I've had thoughts about returning it. Mainly because I was so used to my Nexus 5 form factor. Thought about swapping to a 5X but the 6P is growing on me. I love the phone otherwise.

Development is well underway. Chroma was released yesterday and it's got some decent custom ROM features. I'm going to flash it tonight.
But yeah Xposed can't come soon enough

I've unfortunately not noticed a difference between my N5 and 6P. I've always had 3 bars of LTE sitting at my desk at work and still have 3 bars of LTE. Oh well, it's still fast and I can't complain :)
Allows some apps to gain additional abilities. My personal biggest reason to root is for AdAway and custom DPI among other things.
In case you hadn't noticed. He asked about C to C and 10ft... this is 3m A to C...
I found the review to be fair and honest, particularly the last couple of paragraphs when he's talking about pricing and comparative value.

Excellent, thank you for the response. I'll invest in a couple of the cables in your OP. They're cheap anyways. I have 1 Samsung 2.4A charger and another (can't remember the amps) charger from my N5. Has anyone seen any good prices on 2.4 A type chargers or even new C type chargers?

Just to rehash something here so I can understand correctly. The A to C cables will never charge as fast as the C to C cable and the C charger that came with it the phone? If I want to make sure my phone is getting the best charge, I need to find C to C cables and get another USB-C charger right? The only benefit I can see for getting an A to C cable is to connect to my computer, which the included (albeit absurdly short) A to C cable does fine.
Is everyone else using A to C with older A type chargers? If so how noticeable is the reduced charge time? I love my 6P but this move to USB-C is annoying.

Have the same email. I'm just being extra cautious with my phone for now. If they're having to revise it yet again then I'll happily wait another week. I'd rather get it right than not. I have two on order from the BOGO deal they had going on.
Holy crap, thanks for this recommendation!
